page.title: 13Ecology: FINTRY. General
page.content:
A general appreciation of Fintry's wildlife is possible via these pages: { North Ecology {West East}: Fintry { South {Endrick Water}from its source to Loch Lomond is a{Grade 1 site}in the{Nature {Conservation Review of Great Britain,
Some general points: Traditional rubbish dumping has led to many {garden escapes,}some rare: lily, snowflake, Deptford pink, currants. In recent years{Dutch elm disease}has killed several trees annually. {House martin}numbers have dropped noticeably, particularly in 1985. {Giant Hogweed}has NOT been recorded.
What impact will{afforestation}and { {drainage}have on our flora and fauna? {Only you in the future can know.
